Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person
public class Person extends Object
Represents a Person with a name, surname, and tax code. This class helps developers manage data of type "Person".
Since:
21/01/2025

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person(String name, String surname, String taxCode)
      Constructs an Person object with the given name, surname, and tax code. The tax code is automatically converted to uppercase. tax code Validation:
      • It must contain 16 alphanumeric characters.
      • It must not contain spaces.
      • The first 6 characters must be consonants.
      • The 7th and 8th characters must be numbers.
      Using the following code: (taxCode == null || !taxCode.matches("[A-Z]{6}[0-9]{2}[A-Z0-9]{8}")
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the person
      surname - the surname of the person
      taxCode - the tax code of the person
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tax code is invalid

    • hasSamename

      public boolean hasSamename(Person p)
      Checks if this person has the same name as another person. The comparison is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      p - the person to compare
      Returns:
      true if both Persons have the same name; false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the person in the format: "name: xx surname: xx tax code: xx".
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      a string representation of the person
